text: voter suppression laws have passed in
several red states and swing states even

happens to be iowa where trump actually
uh
won over biden with more than 53 percent
of the vote
but
local politicians in iowa would have you

does that mean that the outcome of the
2020 election in their state wasn't
valid well
what are they doing well it turns out
that they like other states including
georgia and florida have passed all
sorts of provisions that make it harder
for voters to cast their ballot for
instance four months after iowans voted
in record numbers governor kim reynolds
has signed legislation cutting the
state's early voting period and closing
the polls an hour earlier on election
day the law cuts iowa's early voting
period from 29 days to 20 days polls
will now close at 8 pm for state and
federal elections instead of 9 pm so if
you happen to be a worker in the state
of iowa who likes to vote on the same
day of the election and you end up
working a little late that day that one
hour cut off might make all the
difference but seems like that's the
point let me give you more some ballots
used to be counted uh some amounts that
used to be counted will not be counted
anymore for instance ballots must now
arrive
by the time polls close in order to be
counted previously ballots placed in the
mail the day before election day
could be counted as long as they arrived
by noon the following monday that is not
the rule anymore now there is a stricter
cutoff but they didn't stop there the
law strips auditors of much of their
discretion in running elections in their
counties auditors may no longer
establish satellite in-person early
voting sites unless petitioned to do so
by residents
so instead of the auditors being you
know proactive and making it easier and
accessible for voters to cast their
ballot they can't do anything unless
residents organize and demand it
you guys see the problem here
right i mean you're supposed to live in
a democracy where

auditors may no longer establish

only the voter an immediate family

office or place it in the mail
previously anyone the voter designated
could deliver the ballot on the voters

also limits uh ballot drop-off boxes so

thank you for having me
so i wanted to start off by asking you

to kind of give your
your response to what's happening in

you know i want people to understand
that what's happening right now is that
we are seeing the punishment of voters
in this country that there's a new
american voter and there are some that
are very upset about that you know i
want people to understand that up until
recently the baby boomers who my parents
came out of the baby boomer generation
they dominated the political landscape
they had the numbers um i'm from
generation x we never had the numbers
when you're looking at from the
millennial generation on down to
generation z and that you all now young
voters are the largest constituency base
in the country and so there is an effort
what we saw in the 2020 election there
were more young people there are more
communities of color there are more
african-american voters that voted in
this country's history that ever voted
in this country history including new
voters and so there is an attack on
literally this this electoral process
being expanded because voters came out
and voted in record numbers there's this
effort to suppress the vote all across
the board again and so what we're seeing
it's a playbook i always talk about
there's been three strategies that have
always been used as part of voter
suppression one there's always been a
strategy around specifically restricting
access to the ballot just as you talked
about in iowa what's happening in
georgia what's happening all across this
nation of there is no logic behind why
would you want to take a hour off having
people have access to vote like how does
that make the process safer or literally
creating
a shorter period of time for absentee
ballot voting the second strategy has
always been around creating this culture
of fear and so what we're seeing right
now is we're seeing states like in in
florida where the governor of florida is
saying that he's going to create a
special police force to oversee
elections to create this sense of fear
we're also seeing that in georgia where
there's a law that was passed to sb 202
that actually criminalizes organizations
or literally makes it a crime for an
organization to hand out water and so
there's always been the second strategy
that is literally there's access the
restricting access also making sure that
you're creating the culture fear and the
third which is the most egregious which
we're seeing and i always say in georgia
we're seeing all across this nation and
that is weaponizing administrative
process to actually create a process so
that the ruling party can actually go in
and overturn the results they can take
over election boards they can actually
do
major changes to electoral process even
if they throw it out if they don't like
the results and so what we're seeing
right now there's a complete attack on
voters who participated in this last
election that are making up this new
electorate this new multiracial
multi-generational electorate that is
rising up and we're seeing this all
across the board that's why we really
have to focus on how we're going to make
sure we're strengthening our democracy
so let's talk about that because

democrats to actually be able to deliver
i think that schuman others i think some
of what being able to get that vote on

could no longer just run and hide and

that right now we're currently in a

the speech is nice but we need to make
